text.text:
Very good initiative to bride our younger generation with our origin and educate our heritage in an excellent manner.

They exhibit rare artifacts and take us to different timeline. Also we can feel the early settlements and historical facts in a lively manner.

originalText.text:
Very good initiative to bride our younger generation with our origin and educate our heritage in an excellent manner.

They exhibit rare artifacts and take us to different timeline. Also we can feel the early settlements and historical facts in a lively manner.

text.text:
This is a dynamic cultural center with something for folks of all ages. There are interactive exhibits for kids as well as detailed information

Supporting these kinds of centers is important for people of Indian heritage and others alike. It helps to see the strength and diversity of various cultural communities.

originalText.text:
This is a dynamic cultural center with something for folks of all ages. There are interactive exhibits for kids as well as detailed information

Supporting these kinds of centers is important for people of Indian heritage and others alike. It helps to see the strength and diversity of various cultural communities.

text.text: We braved the hot weather and went on a Sunday. Yea. Forgot it was not the best day to go. But didn't regret. There were free vadai and masala tea upon arrival. Some booths for activities and the rest of the museum were on 3rd and 4th floor. At the end of the tour, free packet drinks were given out. Overall, nice tour. We took about an hour. As a Singaporean, we felt we should go take a look and we loved it.

text.text: Not bad an experience. There is free guided tour and the person is so knowledgeable to tell so much. Entry is free for Singaporeans and PRs. Feel free to walk around. Peaceful and not crowded at all, on a weekend.

originalText.text: Not bad an experience. There is free guided tour and the person is so knowledgeable to tell so much. Entry is free for Singaporeans and PRs. Feel free to walk around. Peaceful and not crowded at all, on a weekend.

text.text:
Indian Heritage Centre
5 Campbell lane
209927
Little India
Rating 5

Last Saturday, Sylvia Ang, known as Ang Ley Kheng, together with Angelica, visited the Indian Heritage Centre for the Pongal Tamil Harvest festival. There were stalls selling Indian costumes & Sari. Some selling jewellery. The performances showcase their heritage & culture. It was a feast for the eyes.

We enjoyed the experience. Are gladful that we came.
